subject: Latest pedals
description_text:
Can you tell me about the differences between the latest pedals? I just
ordered the (Plus X Black P3-H3-Plate) and the (VAM PRO 3pcs) what exactly
are the differences to the (PRO X U-P3-H3-1-1) ?  I've heard light,
software, bearings, haptics controller and emi management but that is all
rumors so I thought I should ask the source. I will be using haptics so I
want to make sure I got the right/best pedals for me.

Justin Jones

conversations.body_text: Hi Justin Jones,  The ProX Ultra primarily uses 16-bit signal acquisition and differential signaling, providing strong anti-interference performance, along with 8-step hydraulic fine-tuning and RGB lighting synchronization. The PlusX has also resolved interference issues; however, if your home PC has unreliable grounding, it is recommended to connect a ground wire to the control box and PC case to ensure both work reliably.

Thank you for the fast reply. So the software is the same between them?
It's just the encoding has a higher bit count on the Ultimates? Is that
from a more precise hall effect sensor or a different analog to digital
controller?

I'm using a laptop so I could see grounding being a concern.

Thank you again for the help.

Justin Jones


On Sun, Nov 30, 2025, 9:22 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi Justin Jones,  If you are using a laptop, interference issues usually do not occur. The Ultra uses a 16-bit ADC, and all sensors are pressure sensors. Pressure sensors perform far better than magnetic Hall sensors, and both of our devices use pressure sensors.
Hi Justin Jones,  Additionally, both devices use the same SIMSONN Manager software for calibration and telemetry, and the latest SimHub software can also be used for telemetry-based vibration.
